headers.toc1: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah
headers.mt1: The Book of the Prophet Isaiah

verses.text:
The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning
Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, \add and\add*
Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth: for the \nd LORD\nd*
hath spoken, I have nourished and brought up children, and they have
rebelled against me.

The ox knoweth his owner, and the ass his master’s crib: \add but\add*
Israel doth not know, my people doth not consider.

Ah sinful nation, a people laden with iniquity, a seed of evildoers,
children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the \nd LORD\nd*,
they have provoked the Holy One of Israel unto anger, they are gone
away backward.\f + \fr 1.4  \ft laden: Heb. of heaviness\f*\f + \fr 1.4 
\ft gone…: Heb. alienated, or, separated\f*

Why should ye be stricken any more? ye will revolt more and
more: the whole head is sick, and the whole heart faint.\f + \fr 1.5 
\ft revolt…: Heb. increase revolt\f*

From the sole of the foot even unto the head \add there is\add*
no soundness in it; \add but\add* wounds, and bruises, and putrifying
sores: they have not been closed, neither bound up, neither mollified
with ointment.\f + \fr 1.6  \ft ointment: or, oil\f*

Your country \add is\add* desolate, your cities \add are\add*
burned with fire: your land, strangers devour it in your presence, and
\add it is\add* desolate, as overthrown by strangers.\f + \fr 1.7 
\ft overthrown…: Heb. the overthrow of\f*

And the daughter of Zion is left as a cottage in a vineyard,
as a lodge in a garden of cucumbers, as a besieged city.

Except the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts had left unto us a very small
remnant, we should have been as Sodom, \add and\add* we should have been
like unto Gomorrah.

Hear the word of the \nd LORD\nd*, ye rulers of Sodom; give
ear unto the law of our God, ye people of Gomorrah.

To what purpose \add is\add* the multitude of your sacrifices
unto me? saith the \nd LORD\nd*: I am full of the burnt offerings
of rams, and the fat of fed beasts; and I delight not in the blood
of bullocks, or of lambs, or of he goats.\f + \fr 1.11  \ft he goats: Heb. great he
goats\f*

When ye come to appear before me, who hath required this at your
hand, to tread my courts?\f + \fr 1.12  \ft to appear: Heb. to be
seen\f*

Bring no more vain oblations; incense is an abomination unto me; the new
moons and sabbaths, the calling of assemblies, I cannot away with;
\add it is\add* iniquity, even the solemn meeting.\f + \fr 1.13 
\ft iniquity: or, grief\f*

Your new moons and your appointed feasts my soul hateth: they are a
trouble unto me; I am weary to bear \add them\add*.

And when ye spread forth your hands, I will hide mine eyes
from you: yea, when ye make many prayers, I will not hear: your hands
are full of blood.\f + \fr 1.15  \ft make…: Heb. multiply prayer\f*\f + \fr 1.15 
\ft blood: Heb. bloods\f*

Wash you, make you clean; put away the evil of your doings
from before mine eyes; cease to do evil;

Learn to do well; seek judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge
the fatherless, plead for the widow.\f + \fr 1.17  \ft relieve: or,
righten\f*

Come now, and let us reason together, saith the \nd LORD\nd*:
though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow; though they be
red like crimson, they shall be as wool.

If ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the good of the
land:

But if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the
sword: for the mouth of the \nd LORD\nd* hath spoken \add it\add*.

How is the faithful city become an harlot! it was full of
judgment; righteousness lodged in it; but now murderers.
Thy silver is become dross, thy wine mixed with water:

Thy princes \add are\add* rebellious, and companions of thieves:
every one loveth gifts, and followeth after rewards: they judge not the
fatherless, neither doth the cause of the widow come unto them.

Therefore saith the Lord, the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts, the mighty
One of Israel, Ah, I will ease me of mine adversaries, and avenge
me of mine enemies:

And I will turn my hand upon thee, and purely purge away
thy dross, and take away all thy tin:\f + \fr 1.25  \ft purely: Heb. according to
pureness\f*

And I will restore thy judges as at the first, and thy counsellors
as at the beginning: afterward thou shalt be called, The city of
righteousness, the faithful city.

Zion shall be redeemed with judgment, and her converts with
righteousness.\f + \fr 1.27  \ft her…: or, they that return of her\f*

And the destruction of the transgressors and of the sinners
\add shall be\add* together, and they that forsake the \nd LORD\nd*
shall be consumed.\f + \fr 1.28  \ft destruction: Heb. breaking\f*

For they shall be ashamed of the oaks which ye have desired,
and ye shall be confounded for the gardens that ye have chosen.

For ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth, and as a garden
that hath no water.

And the strong shall be as tow, and the maker of it as a spark,
and they shall both burn together, and none shall quench \add them\add*.\f + \fr 1.31 
\ft maker…: or, and his work\f*

The word that Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and
Jerusalem.

And it shall come to pass in the last days, \add that\add*
the mountain of the \nd LORD’s\nd* house shall be established in the
top of the mountains, and shall be exalted above the hills; and all
nations shall flow unto it.\f + \fr 2.2  \ft established: or, prepared\f*

And many people shall go and say, Come ye, and let us go up
to the mountain of the \nd LORD\nd*, to the house of the God of Jacob;
and he will teach us of his ways, and we will walk in his paths:
for out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the \nd LORD\nd*
from Jerusalem.

And he shall judge among the nations, and shall rebuke many
people: and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their
spears into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up sword against
nation, neither shall they learn war any more.\f + \fr 2.4  \ft pruninghooks: or,
scythes\f*

O house of Jacob, come ye, and let us walk in the light of the
\nd LORD\nd*.

Therefore thou hast forsaken thy people the house of Jacob,
because they be replenished from the east, and \add are\add* soothsayers
like the Philistines, and they please themselves in the children
of strangers.\f + \fr 2.6  \ft from…: or, more than the\f*\f + \fr 2.6 
\ft please…: or, abound with the\f*

Their land also is full of silver and gold, neither \add is there
any\add* end of their treasures; their land is also full of horses, neither
\add is there any\add* end of their chariots:

Their land also is full of idols; they worship the work of their own
hands, that which their own fingers have made:

And the mean man boweth down, and the great man humbleth himself: therefore
forgive them not.

Enter into the rock, and hide thee in the dust, for fear
of the \nd LORD\nd*, and for the glory of his majesty.

The lofty looks of man shall be humbled, and the haughtiness
of men shall be bowed down, and the \nd LORD\nd* alone shall be exalted
in that day.

For the day of the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts \add shall be\add* upon every
\add one that is\add* proud and lofty, and upon every \add one that
is\add* lifted up; and he shall be brought low:

And upon all the cedars of Lebanon, \add that are\add* high
and lifted up, and upon all the oaks of Bashan,

And upon all the high mountains, and upon all the hills \add that
are\add* lifted up,
And upon every high tower, and upon every fenced wall,

And upon all the ships of Tarshish, and upon all pleasant
pictures.\f + \fr 2.16  \ft pleasant…: Heb. pictures of desire\f*

And the loftiness of man shall be bowed down, and the haughtiness
of men shall be made low: and the \nd LORD\nd* alone shall be exalted
in that day.

And the idols he shall utterly abolish.\f + \fr 2.18  \ft he…: or, shall utterly pass
away\f*

And they shall go into the holes of the rocks, and into the
caves of the earth, for fear of the \nd LORD\nd*, and for the glory
of his majesty, when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.\f + \fr 2.19 
\ft of the earth: Heb. of the dust\f*

In that day a man shall cast his idols of silver, and his
idols of gold, which they made \add each one\add* for himself to
worship, to the moles and to the bats;\f + \fr 2.20  \ft his idols of silver…: Heb. the idols of his silver,
etc\f*\f + \fr 2.20  \ft each…: or, for him\f*

To go into the clefts of the rocks, and into the tops of the ragged
rocks, for fear of the \nd LORD\nd*, and for the glory of his majesty,
when he ariseth to shake terribly the earth.

Cease ye from man, whose breath \add is\add* in his nostrils:
for wherein is he to be accounted of?

For, behold, the Lord, the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts, doth take
away from Jerusalem and from Judah the stay and the staff, the whole
stay of bread, and the whole stay of water,

The mighty man, and the man of war, the judge, and the prophet,
and the prudent, and the ancient,

The captain of fifty, and the honourable man, and the counsellor,
and the cunning artificer, and the eloquent orator.\f + \fr 3.3 
\ft the honourable…: Heb. a man eminent in countenance\f*\f + \fr 3.3 
\ft eloquent…: or, skilful of speech\f*

And I will give children \add to be\add* their princes, and
babes shall rule over them.

And the people shall be oppressed, every one by another, and every
one by his neighbour: the child shall behave himself proudly against the
ancient, and the base against the honourable.

When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his
father, \add saying\add*, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and
\add let\add* this ruin \add be\add* under thy hand:

In that day shall he swear, saying, I will not be an healer;
for in my house \add is\add* neither bread nor clothing: make me not a
ruler of the people.\f + \fr 3.7  \ft swear: Heb. lift up the hand\f*\f + \fr 3.7 
\ft healer: Heb. binder up\f*

For Jerusalem is ruined, and Judah is fallen: because their
tongue and their doings \add are\add* against the \nd LORD\nd*, to
provoke the eyes of his glory.

The shew of their countenance doth witness against them; and they
declare their sin as Sodom, they hide \add it\add* not. Woe unto their
soul! for they have rewarded evil unto themselves.

Say ye to the righteous, that \add it shall be\add* well \add with
him:\add* for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.

Woe unto the wicked! \add it shall be\add* ill \add with him:\add*
for the reward of his hands shall be given him.\f + \fr 3.11  \ft given…: Heb. done to
him\f*

\add As for\add* my people, children \add are\add* their
oppressors, and women rule over them. O my people, they which lead thee cause
\add thee\add* to err, and destroy the way of thy paths.\f + \fr 3.12 
\ft lead…: or, call thee blessed\f*\f + \fr 3.12  \ft destroy: Heb. swallow
up\f*

The \nd LORD\nd* standeth up to plead, and standeth to judge
the people.

The \nd LORD\nd* will enter into judgment with the ancients
of his people, and the princes thereof: for ye have eaten up the
vineyard; the spoil of the poor \add is\add* in your houses.\f + \fr 3.14 
\ft eaten: or, burnt\f*

What mean ye \add that\add* ye beat my people to pieces, and
grind the faces of the poor? saith the Lord \nd GOD\nd* of hosts.

Moreover the \nd LORD\nd* saith, Because the daughters of
Zion are haughty, and walk with stretched forth necks and wanton
eyes, walking and mincing \add as\add* they go, and making a tinkling
with their feet:\f + \fr 3.16  \ft wanton…: Heb. deceiving with their
eyes\f*\f + \fr 3.16  \ft mincing: or, tripping nicely\f*

Therefore the Lord will smite with a scab the crown of the
head of the daughters of Zion, and the \nd LORD\nd* will discover
their secret parts.\f + \fr 3.17  \ft discover: Heb. make naked\f*

In that day the Lord will take away the bravery of \add their\add*
tinkling ornaments \add about their feet\add*, and \add their\add*
cauls, and \add their\add* round tires like the moon,\f + \fr 3.18 
\ft cauls: or, networks\f*

The chains, and the bracelets, and the mufflers,\f + \fr 3.19 
\ft chains: or, sweet balls\f*\f + \fr 3.19  \ft mufflers: or, spangled
ornaments\f*

The bonnets, and the ornaments of the legs, and the headbands,
and the tablets, and the earrings,\f + \fr 3.20  \ft tablets: Heb. houses of the
soul\f*
The rings, and nose jewels,

The changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the
wimples, and the crisping pins,
The glasses, and the fine linen, and the hoods, and the vails.

And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* instead of sweet
smell there shall be stink; and instead of a girdle a rent; and instead of well
set hair baldness; and instead of a stomacher a girding of sackcloth;
\add and\add* burning instead of beauty.

Thy men shall fall by the sword, and thy mighty in the war.\f + \fr 3.25 
\ft mighty: Heb. might\f*

And her gates shall lament and mourn; and she \add being\add*
desolate shall sit upon the ground.\f + \fr 3.26  \ft desolate: or, emptied: Heb.
cleansed\f*

And in that day seven women shall take hold of one man, saying,
We will eat our own bread, and wear our own apparel: only let us be
called by thy name, to take away our reproach.\f + \fr 4.1  \ft let…: Heb. let thy name be called upon
us\f*\f + \fr 4.1  \ft to take…: or, take thou away\f*

In that day shall the branch of the \nd LORD\nd* be beautiful
and glorious, and the fruit of the earth \add shall be\add* excellent
and comely for them that are escaped of Israel.\f + \fr 4.2  \ft beautiful…: Heb. beauty and
glory\f*\f + \fr 4.2  \ft them…: Heb. the escaping\f*

And it shall come to pass, \add that he that is\add* left in
Zion, and \add he that\add* remaineth in Jerusalem, shall be called
holy, \add even\add* every one that is written among the living in
Jerusalem:\f + \fr 4.3  \ft among…: or, to life\f*

When the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters
of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from the midst
thereof by the spirit of judgment, and by the spirit of burning.

And the \nd LORD\nd* will create upon every dwelling place
of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day,
and the shining of a flaming fire by night: for upon all the glory
\add shall be\add* a defence.\f + \fr 4.5  \ft upon all: or, above
all\f*\f + \fr 4.5  \ft defence: Heb. covering\f*

And there shall be a tabernacle for a shadow in the daytime
from the heat, and for a place of refuge, and for a covert from storm
and from rain.

Now will I sing to my wellbeloved a song of my beloved touching his
vineyard. My wellbeloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitful hill:\f + \fr 5.1 
\ft a very…: Heb. the horn of the son of oil\f*

And he fenced it, and gathered out the stones thereof, and
planted it with the choicest vine, and built a tower in the midst
of it, and also made a winepress therein: and he looked that it should bring
forth grapes, and it brought forth wild grapes.\f + \fr 5.2  \ft fenced: or, made a wall
about\f*\f + \fr 5.2  \ft made: Heb. hewed\f*

And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge,
I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard.

What could have been done more to my vineyard, that I have not
done in it? wherefore, when I looked that it should bring forth grapes,
brought it forth wild grapes?

And now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard:
I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; \add and\add*
break down the wall thereof, and it shall be trodden down:\f + \fr 5.5 
\ft trodden…: Heb. for a treading\f*

For the vineyard of the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts \add is\add*
the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plant: and he
looked for judgment, but behold oppression; for righteousness, but behold a
cry.\f + \fr 5.7  \ft his…: Heb. plant of his pleasures\f*\f + \fr 5.7 
\ft oppression: Heb. a scab\f*

Woe unto them that join house to house, \add that\add* lay
field to field, till \add there be\add* no place, that they may be
placed alone in the midst of the earth!\f + \fr 5.8  \ft they: Heb.
ye\f*

In mine ears \add said\add* the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts, Of a
truth many houses shall be desolate, \add even\add* great and fair,
without inhabitant.\f + \fr 5.9  \ft In…: or, This is in mine ears, saith the
\+nd LORD\+nd*, etc\f*\f + \fr 5.9  \ft Of a…: Heb. If not, etc\f*

Yea, ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath, and the seed
of an homer shall yield an ephah.

Woe unto them that rise up early in the morning, \add that\add*
they may follow strong drink; that continue until night, \add till\add*
wine inflame them!\f + \fr 5.11  \ft inflame: of, pursue\f*

And the harp, and the viol, the tabret, and pipe, and wine,
are in their feasts: but they regard not the work of the \nd LORD\nd*,
neither consider the operation of his hands.

Therefore my people are gone into captivity, because \add they
have\add* no knowledge: and their honourable men \add are\add* famished,
and their multitude dried up with thirst.\f + \fr 5.13  \ft honourable…: Heb. glory are men of
famine\f*

Therefore hell hath enlarged herself, and opened her mouth
without measure: and their glory, and their multitude, and their
pomp, and he that rejoiceth, shall descend into it.

And the mean man shall be brought down, and the mighty man
shall be humbled, and the eyes of the lofty shall be humbled:

But the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts shall be exalted in judgment,
and God that is holy shall be sanctified in righteousness.\f + \fr 5.16 
\ft God…: or, the holy God: Heb. the God the holy\f*

Then shall the lambs feed after their manner, and the waste
places of the fat ones shall strangers eat.

Woe unto them that draw iniquity with cords of vanity, and
sin as it were with a cart rope:

That say, Let him make speed, \add and\add* hasten his work,
that we may see \add it:\add* and let the counsel of the Holy One
of Israel draw nigh and come, that we may know \add it\add*!

Woe unto them that call evil good, and good evil; that put
darkness for light, and light for darkness; that put bitter for sweet,
and sweet for bitter!\f + \fr 5.20  \ft call…: Heb. say concerning evil, It is good,
etc\f*

Woe unto \add them that are\add* wise in their own eyes, and
prudent in their own sight!\f + \fr 5.21  \ft in their own sight: Heb. before their
face\f*

Woe unto \add them that are\add* mighty to drink wine, and
men of strength to mingle strong drink:

Which justify the wicked for reward, and take away the righteousness
of the righteous from him!

Therefore as the fire devoureth  the stubble, and the flame
consumeth the chaff, \add so\add* their root shall be as rottenness,
and their blossom shall go up as dust: because they have cast away
the law of the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts, and despised the word of the Holy
One of Israel.\f + \fr 5.24  \ft fire: Heb. tongue of fire\f*

Therefore is the anger of the \nd LORD\nd* kindled against his
people, and he hath stretched forth his hand against them, and hath
smitten them: and the hills did tremble, and their carcases \add were\add*
torn in the midst of the streets. For all this his anger is not turned
away, but his hand \add is\add* stretched out still.\f + \fr 5.25 
\ft torn: or, as dung\f*

And he will lift up an ensign to the nations from far, and will
hiss unto them from the end of the earth: and, behold, they shall
come with speed swiftly:

None shall be weary nor stumble among them; none shall slumber
nor sleep; neither shall the girdle of their loins be loosed, nor the
latchet of their shoes be broken:

Whose arrows \add are\add* sharp, and all their bows bent,
their horses’ hoofs shall be counted like flint, and their wheels
like a whirlwind:

Their roaring \add shall be\add* like a lion, they shall roar
like young lions: yea, they shall roar, and lay hold of the prey, and shall carry
\add it\add* away safe, and none shall deliver \add it\add*.

And in that day they shall roar against them like the roaring
of the sea: and if \add one\add* look unto the land, behold darkness
\add and\add* sorrow, and the light is darkened in the heavens thereof.\f + \fr 5.30 
\ft sorrow: or, distress\f*\f + \fr 5.30  \ft and the light…: or, when it is light, it shall be dark in the destructions
thereof\f*

In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the Lord sitting
upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.\f + \fr 6.1 
\ft his…: or, the skirts thereof\f*

Above it stood the seraphims: each one had six wings; with
twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with
twain he did fly.

And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy, \add is\add*
the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts: the whole earth \add is\add* full of his
glory.\f + \fr 6.3  \ft one…: Heb. this cried to this\f*\f + \fr 6.3 
\ft the whole…: Heb. his glory is the fulness of the whole earth\f*

And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried,
and the house was filled with smoke.\f + \fr 6.4  \ft door: Heb.
thresholds\f*

Then said I, Woe \add is\add* me! for I am undone; because I
\add am\add* a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a
people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the \nd LORD\nd*
of hosts.\f + \fr 6.5  \ft undone: Heb. cut off\f*

Then flew one of the seraphims unto me, having a live coal
in his hand, \add which\add* he had taken with the tongs from off the
altar:\f + \fr 6.6  \ft having…: Heb. and in his hand a live coal\f*

And he laid \add it\add* upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath
touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.\f + \fr 6.7 
\ft laid…: Heb. caused it to touch\f*

Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send,
and who will go for us? Then said I, Here \add am\add* I; send me.\f + \fr 6.8 
\ft Here…: Heb. behold me\f*

And he said, Go, and tell this people, Hear ye indeed, but
understand not; and see ye indeed, but perceive not.\f + \fr 6.9 
\ft indeed, but understand: or, without ceasing, etc: Heb. in hearing,
etc\f*

Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy,
and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their
ears, and understand with their heart, and convert, and be healed.

Then said I, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities
be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the
land be utterly desolate,\f + \fr 6.11  \ft utterly…: Heb. desolate with
desolation\f*

And the \nd LORD\nd* have removed men far away, and \add there
be\add* a great forsaking in the midst of the land.

But yet in it \add shall be\add* a tenth, and \add it\add*
shall return, and shall be eaten: as a teil tree, and as an oak,
whose substance \add is\add* in them, when they cast \add their leaves:
so\add* the holy seed \add shall be\add* the substance thereof.\f + \fr 6.13 
\ft and it…: or, when it is returned, and hath been broused\f*\f + \fr 6.13 
\ft substance: or, stock, or, stem\f*

And it came to pass in the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham,
the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, \add that\add* Rezin the king of
Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up toward
Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.

And it was told the house of David, saying, Syria is confederate
with Ephraim. And his heart was moved, and the heart of his people,
as the trees of the wood are moved with the wind.\f + \fr 7.2  \ft is confederate…: Heb. resteth
on\f*

Then said the \nd LORD\nd* unto Isaiah, Go forth now to meet
Ahaz, thou, and Shear-jashub thy son, at the end of the conduit of the
upper pool in the highway of the fuller’s field;\f + \fr 7.3  \ft Shear-jashub: that is, The remnant shall
return\f*\f + \fr 7.3  \ft highway: or, causeway\f*

And say unto him, Take heed, and be quiet; fear not, neither be
fainthearted for the two tails of these smoking firebrands, for the
fierce anger of Rezin with Syria, and of the son of Remaliah.\f + \fr 7.4 
\ft neither…: Heb. let not thy heart be tender\f*

Because Syria, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah, have taken
evil counsel against thee, saying,

Let us go up against Judah, and vex it, and let us make a breach
therein for us, and set a king in the midst of it, \add even\add*
the son of Tabeal:\f + \fr 7.6  \ft vex: or, waken\f*
Thus saith the Lord \nd GOD\nd*, It shall not stand, neither shall it come to pass.

For the head of Syria \add is\add* Damascus, and the head of
Damascus \add is\add* Rezin; and within threescore and five years
shall Ephraim be broken, that it be not a people.\f + \fr 7.8  \ft that…: Heb. from a
people\f*

And the head of Ephraim \add is\add* Samaria, and the head
of Samaria \add is\add* Remaliah’s son. If ye will not believe, surely ye shall not be
established.\f + \fr 7.9  \ft If…: or, Do ye not believe? it is because ye are not
stable\f*

Moreover the \nd LORD\nd* spake again unto Ahaz, saying,\f + \fr 7.10 
\ft Moreover…: Heb. And the \+nd LORD\+nd* added to speak\f*

Ask thee a sign of the \nd LORD\nd* thy God; ask it either in the
depth, or in the height above.\f + \fr 7.11  \ft ask it…: or, make thy petition
